channel.title: Running
channel.description: I just recently started to get into running (the same type done in cross country), and it is definitely a challenge, but it is a form of meditation while also giving me that physical training to keep myself in shape. I was actually going to join my high school cross country team this year, but I couldn't at the season start due to my work schedule, which is a huge bummer. I was wondering if anyone else here likes to run, and if so, what is your running routine like?

item.title: Running
item.dc:creator: @Revamp_dis_Shit Revamp dis Shit
item.description:
@Revamp_dis_Shit wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:2, topic:533728”]Stupid noob there’s already a topic about this

Just kidding, it’s well over a year old. Might as well start a new one.

My opinion? Running sucks. But I think that simply because I black out a few minutes into a constant run/jog regardless of what shape I’m in[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Running
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

I love running although I can’t do much anymore with work and school. I decided that getting job experience while in school is worth more to me than being a student-athlete.

Times:
8K - 30:01 (horrible race, really really hard)
5K - 17:43 (iirc 2013)
3200 - 12:18 (2010)
1600 - 4:58 (2013)
1500 - 4:44 (2013)
800 - 1:55 (2013)
400 - 49.77 (2013)

I’m a mid-distance oriented person. I’m not quick, but I’m quick for a mid distance. I’ve never had any trouble with my legs, only back aches every 6 months or so.

Read full topic

item.title: Running
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

kickingjamie:

I’d much rather go for a bike ride, that or short distance-high intensity activities.

I’ve wanted to try biking, but none of my friends do it and I’m not the type of person that enjoys doing activities like that alone.

Read full topic

item.title: Running
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“rip4d, post:7, topic:533728”]I started cross-country this year and I love it. Best time for a 5k is only 19:57 but its a start. I’ll usually run 4-6 miles a day, but lately my knees have been bad (clicking when running, a lot of pain when even walking), so I’ve been doing bike rides instead.[/quote]^ running does ur knees in mate, not worth it

Read full topic

item.title: Running
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

I started cross-country this year and I love it. Best time for a 5k is only 19:57 but its a start. I’ll usually run 4-6 miles a day, but lately my knees have been bad (clicking when running, a lot of pain when even walking), so I’ve been doing bike rides instead.

Read full topic

item.title: Running
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

I do XC, I’m decent. 17:25 pr on a 5k.
What I recommend? I enjoy 60 minute easy runs, with workouts (track style workouts) in between. If you have a harder track workout planned, do a 45 minute run the day before. I find running for x amount of time is better then x amount of distance

Read full topic

item.title: Running
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

I’m a big runner myself. Though I have no interest in long distance running. Short, intense runs are much better for fitness.
I run 4.2km (measured by google maps) every morning to my gym in about 20~ minutes, and it has many uphills and a huge down hill, so it’s fairly intense. I then do my daily workout (usually takes about 1h30m~), and run home.

Wearing a HRM while running has served as a valuable asset to my training.

Read full topic

item.title: Running
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

Elrick:

During the summer I started prepping for 5k runs. I started off with 1 mile runs but then just realized that I was never going to get anywhere by running for 14-15 minutes. So I upped it to 2 miles, and then it just quickly spread to the 3.1 (5k). It definitely puts a lot of strain on your body, even to maintain a 15 minute per mile speed. I believe I managed to get down to 40 minutes by the end. It feels great to finish

Yeah, I’m hoping to get around a 6 minute pace for 5ks.

Read full topic
